heading: Structure of the book
text: Chapter 1: Gmacs - get installedChapter 2: File OrganisationChapter 3: Data file descriptionChapter 4: Control file descriptionChapter 5: Projection file descriptionChapter 6: set functions help user fill/modify input files (developed)Chapter 7: Running Gmacs using gmr package plot resultsChapter 8: Building first stock assessment using GmacsChapter 9: Producing stock assessment documentsChapter 10: Frequently Asked Questions

heading: License
text: Gmacs project still funded National Marine Fisheries Service Bering Sea Fisheries Research Foundation. product currently hosted Nation Oceanic Atmospheric Administration (NOAA).

heading: What is Gmacs ?
text: Gmacs statistical size-structured population modeling framework designed flexible, scalable, useful data-limited data-rich situations. standard assessment models, allows determine impact fishing historical current abundance population evaluate sustainable rate removals (.e., catches).framework can incorporate multiple data types variety sources (fisheries, surveys) combing form integrated analysis (Maunder Punt, 2013; Punt et al., 2013)). approach allows various kinds data different (sometimes incomplete) collection histories provide complementary information fished stocks.Initially developed assess red king crab stocks Alaska, Gmacs designed similar flexibility provided age-structured stock assessment modelling frameworks like Stock Synthesis CASAL. Similar model, Gmacs population sub-model simulates stock biological dynamics (growth, maturity,fecundity, recruitment, molting), observation sub-model estimates expected values different kind data (e.g. fishery /survey abundance indices, fisheries discard data, size composition data, …) statistical sub-model quantify goodness fit provides best-fitting parameters estimates associated variance.Gmacs open source program coded C++ implemented Automatic Differentiation Model Builder (ADMB; Fournier et al. (2012)) parameter estimation.

heading: Getting Gmacs installed
text: provide detailed instruction ho installing Gmacs popular operating systems (Windows, Mac linux computers).

heading: Installing Gmacs
text:
latest version Gmacs can download .Quick start windows machines
Download gmacs-develop.zip.
Unzip folder create c:/gmacs-develop something similar.
Open ADMB Command windows.
Navigate c:/gmacs-develop/src type make.bat.
Gmacs executable (gmacs.exe) built inside src/ folder.
See Chapter 7 building model.
Download gmacs-develop.zip.Unzip folder create c:/gmacs-develop something similar.Open ADMB Command windows.Navigate c:/gmacs-develop/src type make.bat.Gmacs executable (gmacs.exe) built inside src/ folder.See Chapter 7 building model.Quick start Mac machines
Download gmacs-develop.zip.
Unzip folder create /users/-name/gmacs-develop something similar.
Open Terminal
Navigate /users/-name/gmacs-develop/src.
Edit make file reference local machine.
Return Terminal type make get started.
Gmacs executable (gmacs.exe) built inside src/ folder.
See Chapter 7 building model.
Download gmacs-develop.zip.Unzip folder create /users/-name/gmacs-develop something similar.Open TerminalNavigate /users/-name/gmacs-develop/src.Edit make file reference local machine.Return Terminal type make get started.Gmacs executable (gmacs.exe) built inside src/ folder.See Chapter 7 building model.Installation LinuxInstalling ADMB Linux easy via GitHub….

heading: What are the available tools for working with Gmacs?
text: Numerous tools developed facilitate spread use Gmacs. include various repositories GitHub well :gmr: purpose-built R package plotting Gmacs outputs work Gmacs files R.Gmad: dedicated library generate stock assessment documents pdf form using Gmacs outputs.

heading: 2 File organisation
text: Gmacs controlled series text-based input files. files can prepared edited using text editor choice.

heading: 2.1 Input Files
text: model.dat: file containing model dimensions data (required).model.ctl: file containing set-parameters options chose (required).model.prj: file containing specifications reference points projections (required).gmacs.dat: file containing names files specified ordered .dat, .ctl, .prj.
